data.value: DataArray provides a wrapper around numpy ndarrays that uses labeled dimensions and coordinates to support metadata aware operations. The API is similar to that for the pandas Series or DataFrame, but DataArray objects can have any number of dimensions, and their contents have fixed data types.
Additional features over raw numpy arrays:
Apply operations over dimensions by name:
Select or assign values by integer location (like numpy):
) vectorize across   multiple dimensions (known in numpy as "broadcasting") based on   dimension names, regardless of their original order.
Keep track of arbitrary metadata in the form of a Python   dictionary:
Getting items from or doing mathematical operations with a DataArray always returns another DataArray.
Values for this array. Must be an
, ndarray like, or castable to an
. If a self-described xarray or pandas object, attempts are made to use this array's metadata to fill in other unspecified arguments. A view of the array's data is used instead of a copy if possible.
Coordinates (tick labels) to use for indexing along each dimension. The following notations are accepted:
sequence of tuples that are valid arguments for
- (dims, data)   - (dims, data, attrs)   - (dims, data, attrs, encoding)
Additionally, it is possible to define a coord whose name does not match the dimension name, or a coord based on multiple dimensions, with one of the following notations:
mapping {coord name: (tuple of dimension names, array-like)}

children.type_: sequence or dict of array_like, optional

data.value: Name(s) of the data dimension(s). Must be either a hashable (only for 1D data) or a sequence of hashables with length equal to the number of dimensions. If this argument is omitted, dimension names are taken from

children.type_: hashable or sequence of hashable, optional

data.value: Attributes to assign to the new instance. By default, an empty attribute dictionary is initialized.
N-dimensional array with labeled coordinates and dimensions.

<xarray.DataArray ()>
array(7.18177696)
Coordinates:
    lon             float64 -99.32
    lat             float64 42.21
    time            datetime64[ns] 2014-09-08
    reference_time  datetime64[ns] 2014-09-05
Attributes:
    description:  Ambient temperature.
    units:        degC
